title: Adaptive Critic Method Application for Solving H-Infinity Optimal Control Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Blended practical environments using digital devices with theoretical instruction, providing case-based learning optimized for corporate managers

learning_goals: Learners can design the value function Q(x, u, w) for H-infinity optimal control problems using adaptive critique methods.
Learners can implement algorithms to solve the Game-Theoretic Algebraic Riccati Equation (GARE) in model-free environments.
Learners can apply Q-learning-based ADP approaches to industrial cases similar to the F-16 aircraft autopilot system.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
